properties.description: Canal pancakes began as Shandong grain flatbreads, but were adapted along the route—stuffed with Huai’an tea crisps and brushed with Suzhou rose jam. Made extra large (up to 1 meter wide), they were ideal travel rations for boatmen.

At salt merchant banquets, jade shumai blended northern wheat skins with a southern filling of pond greens and Zhenjiang vinegar. Topped with Hongze Lake shrimp roe, its translucent wrapper gleamed like jade—a symbol of edible luxury.
